scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Coal Mine Safety and Disasters/Explosions series (dated 1941-2001, undated; 1.0 cubic feet; 1 box; 27 folders) comprises various reports, newspaper clippings, and industry documents detailing coal mine safety from primarily the twentieth century, Kentucky mine disasters/explosions, scans and writings on Charles Norwood, and a 1976 technical report on Coal Miner Safety and Health. Mine disasters/ explosions cover the following counties: Bell, Floyd, Harlan, Hopkins, Johnson, Knott, Leslie, Letcher, Muhlenberg, Ohio, Perry, Pike, Union, and Webster.
